comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Looking east from George Street. Seems to have been a popular corner to photograph: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2610181978/ and www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2376884304/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The Arc lamp post (note on left) dates this as post 1904 - cityofsydney.nsw.gov.au/history/SydneyStreets/Minding_the...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: And the electric tram on this line (previously a cable tram) as post 1905.

comment.author: 70864185@N00
comment._content: Not that it isn't now, but Sydney really was an amazing city back then, it appears to have had a wonderful character. Comparing it to modern buildings of glass and concrete, I can't help wish it remained how it was.

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: There seems to be three police officers at this intersection. One in the middle, one to his right (mostly obscured by two pedestrians) and one at left, left of the light pole.
